lead_paragraph: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, facing multiple corruption investigations, will become President Dilma Rousseff’s chief of staff, a position that offers him increased protection.

byline.contributor: Anna Jean Kaiser and Mariana Simões contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Amid Scandal, Brazil’s Leader Gives Predecessor Legal Shield
headline.main: Ex-President ‘Lula’ Joins Brazil’s Cabinet, Gaining Legal Shield

snippet: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, facing multiple corruption investigations, will become President Dilma Rousseff’s chief of staff, a position that offers him increased protection.
abstract: Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff announces she is making her embattled mentor and predecessor Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva her chief of staff, effectively shielding da Silva from prosecution over corruption charges; move comes amid intensifying political upheaval as Rousseff struggles to retain her office while protesters demand her ouster and lawmakers, many of whom are also under scrutiny, seek to impeach her.
